Articles.Content:
***UPDATE***

After 9 years stranded in space, Jeb is home!

Intrepid Kerbal Bill Kerman, the first Kerbal to (crash)land on the Mun, was sitting in his Goliath rocket in Kerbin orbit, preparing to rescue his would-be rescuers from the moon (they ran out of fuel during the first attempt to rescue Bill), when he heard that there were no plans to rescue his pal Jeb from solar orbit in the vicinity of Eve. So he cancelled his upcoming TMI burn maneuver and instead plotted a slingshot to the inner system. After a 3 year chase, Jeb exhausted his remaining RCS fuel and rendezvoused with the Goliath stack. Since his Monkeylauncher 'Kspam Kan' capsule was not fitted with a docking port, he had to spacewalk across to join Bill in his capsule, and they lit out for home. Jeb was in too much of a hurry to get home to plot a landing, and they splashed down in the middle of the southern ocean. Recovery vessels are now on route.

Image: A happy day for Jeb

http://s6.postimg.org/ca94lvjs1/Jeb_Rescue_2.jpg' alt='Jeb_Rescue_2.jpg'> screencast

He's at a research base at Laythe at my career mode save, getting me loads of science. On my oldest save he's on a capsule on Eve with Bob and Bill. Meanwhile, in my "testing" save he's somewhere outside of Kerbol's SOI.
Dead while performing a test mission for an interplanetary cruiser. Was testing if its unproven parachute system offered landing capability. It did not.

Jeb is safely orbiting Kerbin in an orbit that no other ship is currently using. Tricked him into the capsule with a promise of deep space exploration and EVA on Eeloo. Once safely locked in the launch to orbit somehow never quite made the rendezvous with the right delivery vehicle nor ever lined up with the right transit window. I think he is still believes its going to happen.
Jebediah died when I was doing science above Kerbin; not enough fuel to get into orbit. I splashed down into Kerbin's oceans. He died with a smile on his face. :'(

On the Mun, commanding Mun Base 1. (Which is an actual base, not just a crashed lander.)

He's due for rotation in a month or so, sooner if he gets bored.
Currently at the Astronaut Complex awaiting assignment after landing a crappy plane also carrying Bill, Bob, and three tons of snacks for motivation.

I was building the Mir, After sending the core up, I sent the Kvant 1 module. Which holds one kerbal, plus it doesn't have a IVA or eva hatch, No way of telling if theres a kerbal in there.

I few minutes before launch, Jeb went inside it without me knowing, I only found out when I was about to fly a plane, I realize Jeb wasn't available........

Had to sent a Rocket and install crew manifest to get him back.
He's inside a LK lander on Minmus.
Stuck on the Mun with Bill and Bob, Still smiling away.
Dead for the second time in my career save.

"Jebediah was a Kerbal,

Was a good friend of mine,

Never understood a single word he said,

but I helped him a drink his wine.

And he always had some mighty fine wine!"

Well Jebediah crashed in his space suit flying 53m/s into the rim of a crater within the Farside Crater. He had been waiting a couple of days for rescue and didn't want to walk 10Km so he elected to fly using his manuvering pack. As he would have run out of fuel at the 6 or 7 km mark going a survivable speed, he elected to exceed his suit tolerences. It was not his smartest move. His accelerated clone made a later mission to the Polar Crater and returned unscathed. He is currently standing in reserve for a potential rescue mission in case Bill and Bob have trouble at Gilly.

My Jeb died in a experimental rocket-propelled transport system, in a bid to get science outside KSC.

I should really make a memorial..

<strike>Somewhere in a parallel universe</strike>

In his room, doing science.

Sandbox: On Eeloo with Bill in a severely damaged lander awaiting the next launch window back home, blissfully unaware that the dV left in the lander will be cutting it really close. At least the landing legs all broke off, so that helps.

Career: On his way to Duna, Eve and their moons to gather science so i can build him an even bigger, faster and explodier rocket.

My Jeb?

Holding onto a rocket headed for Jool.

For !!SCIENCE!! And also to see if the most badass Kerbal ever can survive a Gas Giant.
Jeb is sitting in the pilot's lounge waiting for a Mun mission

I put the big three in orbit to keep them safe. They're in my new space station, awaiting the building of my first starship, even though it'll probably just end up orbiting Jool, as most things tend to do when I put them out in space.

Orbiting Kerbin. No, not in a station. Or in a lander. Or in any kind of spacecraft. He's out there, alone, only with his spacesuit and a third of his RCS fuel.

His space station Ilmarinen was destroyed after collision with a large jettisoned fuel tank while on EVA. His only company Bob was killed in the explosion, and Jeb is stranded in the middle of a debris field high above Kerbin

Soon I'll be sending a rescue craft, Ahti II, with Bill on board (who has saved Jebediah several times). Ahti II will be armed with a remote-controlled unit with a cluster of small rockets, the purpose of which will be clearing the debris field for safe rescue.

Upon debriefing and collecting all that science his green skull is holding within, he will be reassigned for MÃƒÂ¼nar missions, and ultimately to a permanent MÃƒÂ¼n base.
Recently recovered after spending a couple of years stranded in Duna orbit.
Hanging out in the pilots lounge after returning from a 1000+ day journey to Jool and back, preparing for a landing on Duna.
Driving around Kerbin on his Rocket Science Rover.
In interplanetary space in a lander that just left the mun, failed to return home, then got slingshotted by the mun into interplanetary space.

Currently at KSC, hiding from the scientists who have just invented Ion engines. He won't be needed for any missions for a little while, since the current project involves dispatching a lot of automated tankers. We'll have to go and convince him that the scientists are NOT witches and wizards, and that he has important work to do.
Jeb just missed the runway testing this newfangled device called a "research aeroplane." Boom.
